qas.question: What was the population of New York City in 2014?
What is the US city with the second largest population?
How many people moved to New York City between April 2010 and July 2014?
Approximately what percentage is New York City's population of the entire state's population?
About what percentage is New York City's population of the New York metropolitan area's population?
What is the population of NYC as of 2014?
The second largest city in the US is what?
What percentage of people that live in the state of New York live in New York City?

context: New York City is the most-populous city in the United States, with an estimated record high of <a0_0><a5_0>8,491,079<a5_0/><a0_0/> residents as of 2014, incorporating more immigration into the city than outmigration since the 2010 United States Census. More than twice as many people live in New York City as in the second-most populous U.S. city (<a1_0><a6_0>Los Angeles<a6_0/><a1_0/>), and within a smaller area. New York City gained more residents between April 2010 and July 2014 (<a2_0>316,000<a2_0/>) than any other U.S. city. New York City's population amounts to about <a3_0><a4_0><a7_0>40<a7_0/>%<a4_0/><a3_0/> of New York State's population and a similar percentage of the New York metropolitan area population.
